root.name: Six-Gun Shootout: Gunfights of the Wild West
root.description: Six-Gun Shootout is a turn-based strategy game which allows the player to control a team of gunfighters. The game came with several scenarios based on real historical situations (Such as the Gun Fight at the O.K. Corral) as well as situation based on pop culture Western films such as The Good, the Bad and The Ugly.Two player shootouts were supported via hot-seat play where each player controlled one team.A variety of weapons were available to the player including pistols, long rifles, shotguns and dynamite which could alter terrain features like walls and fences. Characters could have three stances: standing, kneeling, prone. This would affect their movement rate as well allow them to "take cover" behind objects so that other character could not see them.Players also had the ability to customize each of the characters on their team, changing names and even equipment available for the fight.
